reviews.review: w

NB: I got DBD for free on Epic during December 2021, but I bought it and many of its DLCs on Steam and transferred my progress recently (yay for cross-progression!), so I've played for probably around a couple hundred more hours than it says here.

I really love DBD. As with any popular game it has its critics, but I'd say most of its problems are exaggerated. It's a fun multiplayer survival game that lets you play in many different ways, both with and against other players. It regularly gets new characters, perks and maps.

[b]"Paywall"[/b]
The long list of DLCs may make it look like you need to pay to unlock everything but all perks and characters are unlockable through in-game XP-earned currency called iridescent shards, so you can technically access everything (other than optional Rift passes for cosmetics) as long as you play enough. Maps are available to everyone. There are collaborations with lots of horror media icons like the Resident Evil games, Silent Hill, Saw, and so on, and everything goes on sale pretty often so if you specifically like something and don't want to grind for it you can get it for less than a fiver :)

[b]Community[/b]
Before I tried out the game I was hesitant because I'd heard the community was toxic. There's definitely trolling every now and then, and playing can be frustrating sometimes, but I'd say I've had far more positive encounters than bad ones when it comes to post-game chat and funny things happening in matches. I've laughed and had lots of fun both when playing with friends and when playing solo with randoms. There's no voice chat which is also nice for anyone who dislikes that. I'm not really involved with anything like discord or reddit but I know the game has a very active community for whoever gets into it.

[b]Learning Curve[/b]
What first made me love the game was how simple it is to get started. Controls are easy to learn and your goals as killer or survivor aren't complicated but can still be difficult to reach. Survivor gameplay mainly consists of quick-time events and evasion, killer gameplay is a bit more varied with each character but involves chasing and controlling the progress of survivors while sacrificing them. But even though it's easy to get started, there's tons to learn and practice as you play, which keeps the game fresh and exciting for many hours without being too punishing.

[b]Dev Engagement[/b]
The devs get a lot of hate and I'd say most of it is unwarranted. New "chapters" (usually new killer, survivor, and map) are released around every three months. Events happen often, usually for holidays like Christmas, St Valentine's, Chinese New Year etc. The devs might not release weekly patches or anything but they're decently good at listening to players, for example through the prestige, matchmaking, and perk reworks coming later this year. I've only been playing for half a year so maybe I'm not the most knowledgeable on this but personally I'm pretty happy with the upkeep the game gets. There's also lots of cosmetic options for the characters and more get added regularly which is nice :D

[b]TL;DR[/b]
DBD is fun and easy to get started with while staying exciting for a long time. You can play as, with, or against both original characters and classics from the horror-genre. Most of the bad things you might have heard are probably exaggerated. I didn't think I'd like it but I ended up loving it. Try it and see what you think! :]

Dead by Daylight is a great horror game. It's very fun to play and consists of four survivors trying to escape from one killer. You can choose between different survivors and perks to go with them as well as different killers with perks to go with them too. No level is the same since every time you play the maps are randomized meaning even when you're on the same map it will be set up different each time. This game is great, I haven't had any trouble with it since I've had it. If you have played Friday the 13th: The Game and liked it then you'll love this one.

it's the best asymmetrical game by far and a good game on its own.
What I have heard of the developers doesn't listen to their community from day 1.
They justify their decisions on internal stats and mix it up with their perception.
 
The game itself is survivor sided by perks and map design.
So if you want a challenging experience (and nerves of steal) without tunneling and camping you should play killer.
And if you want fun you play in a survivor SWF and abuse busted structures.
Now at patch 6.0.1 they announced to change 40 perks in total which include both sides (very necessary).

In my opinion they should buff the weaker killers (freddy, trapper, doc, pig and a lot other) so the games doesn't become repetitive.
I feel this game is pretty casual, only has 1 play mode so really doesn't deserve more than a couple hundred hours at max.
There are many other bad claims I could make of this game but it's not worth it.

In the end you can have a pretty fun time playing it. cheers.

A very fun multiplayer game. Not too scary, so if that scares you I was the same but it really is not bad. The gameplay is good. Had some EAC (Easy Anti-Cheat) problems but uninstalled and reinstalled it and all those problems were solved. All in all, a great game and a great set of developers.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories

Eu recomendo o jogo mas gostava que os Devs se preocupassem mais em arranjar o jogo do que em fazer dinheiro com os DLCs. Tirem 3 meses ou o que precisarem para fazer o jogo pesar menos, ter escolhas de gráficos decentes (porque mudar a resolução é a unica coisa que posso mudar para tentar ter mais frames. Absolutamente rídiculo para um jogo de pc com tantos anos), arranjar bugs. O jogo em si é fixe e gosto das mecanicas mas é um desperdicío se não tiver bem programado e desenvolvido

Dead by Daylight(DBD) is probably one of the best games i have ever played, specially with friends.
Every match is different and interesting. Theres so much good content and interesting game mechanics.
Some might say "Game is killer sided" or "Game is survivor sided", but both parties have strong add on perks etc, specially the new killer dredge hes broken. But i believe that a balance between killer and survivor perks does exist somewhere. Also dbd has iconic killers and survivors for an example its very fun to play against micheal myers, freddy or demogorgon. I would rate this game a 10/10 and would recommend it to everyone!
